Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Arrange the cauliflower florets on a baking sheet and brush them with olive oil. Bake in the preheated oven until they start to turn brown, approximately 30 minutes. Set aside.

While the cauliflower is baking, add the ground beef and onion to a large pot over medium heat, cooking and stirring until the meat is browned, approximately 10 minutes. As it cooks, break the meat into crumbles. Remove from heat.
In a saucepan, bring the water to a boil, then add the salt, black pepper, cumin, oregano, curry powder, and turmeric.

Combine the cooked cauliflower and garlic with the ground beef and onion in the large pot, then stir in the white rice. Pour the seasoned water over the rice in the pot and bring it to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer, cover the pot, and cook until the rice is tender and the water has been absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let it sit covered for 5 to 10 minutes to help dry the rice.
To serve, position a large serving platter over the uncovered pot and invert to transfer the contents onto the platter.
